revised_title: Uranium-Series Ages of Speleothems and Quaternary Climate Correlation in Northwest England
tldr: This study presents the results of dating 87 speleothems from caves in the Craven district of northwest England, providing insights into the area's palaeoclimatic history. The research correlates periods of abundant speleothem growth with interglacial isotope stages and periods of zero growth with glacial stages. The findings may also be related to the British Quaternary sequence within the range of radiocarbon determinations.
